prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0028, 0.3736, 0.0] Next, draw the 2D sketch for the base of the prism on face 1 of the new coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following loops and lines: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7472, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7472, 0.0], End Point [0.7472, 0.7472] - Line 3: Start Point [0.7472, 0.7472], End Point [0.0, 0.7472] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.7472], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the sketch, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter with a value of 0.7472. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrude depth of 0.0, and towards the opposite normal vector with an extrude depth of 0.3736. The length, width, and height of part 1 are 0.7472, 0.3736, and 0.7472 respectively. **Part 2 Instructions** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3736, 0.0] Next, draw the 2D sketch for the base of the prism on face 1 of the new coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following loops and lines: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7472, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.7472, 0.0], End Point [0.7472, 0.3736] - Line 3: Start Point [0.7472, 0.3736], End Point [0.3736, 0.3736] - Line 4: Start Point [0.3736, 0.3736], End Point [0.3736, 0.7472] - Line 5: Start Point [0.3736, 0.7472], End Point [0.0, 0.7472] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.7472], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the sketch, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter with a value of 0.7472. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrude depth of 0.3736, and towards the opposite normal vector with an extrude depth of 0.0. The length, width, and height of part 2 are 0.7472</description>

Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0968, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0968 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a entirely new solid body</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This sketch has 1 face, and the only loop (loop\\_1) consists of 4 lines. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch:** Apply a 3D rotation to the 2D sketch plane using the following euler angles: 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0. Shift the 2D sketch plane using a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** to generate the 3D model: Extrude the rectangle with the given depth (towards the normal) as 0.4213, and no extrusion towards the opposite direction of the normals (0.0). Use a scaling parameter of 0.75 when extruding the sketch. The resulting solid body is a new prism part. The length is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.4213 units for the prism part. (Note: This response aims to meet all the provided formatting and content requirements.)</description>
